data.title: The Theater that was Rome
data.text:
Farnese, Ranuccio I, Duke of Parma and Piacenza (1569-1622)

Variant Names

Farnese, Ranutii

Dates

b. 1569, Parma

d. 1622

Occupation(s)

noble

ruler

patron

Biography

Son of Alessandro Farnese and Maria of Portugal, he is best known for the construction of the Teatro Farnese at Parma. He married Margherita Aldobrandini, niece of Clement VIII.

Ranuccio I was an heir to the Portuguese throne, but did not pursue his ascendancy. In 1612 he put down a conspiracy against him that resulted in the murder of many Piacentine nobles, some of them unjustly, which damaged his reputation among many Italian monarchs.

EL

Sources
